meanings.definition: A Jewish prayer book for the High Holy Days.
meanings.sent1: During Yom Kippur, the rabbi read from the mahzor to lead the congregation in prayer.
meanings.sent2: The mahzor contains special prayers for Rosh Hashanah and Yom Kippur.
meanings.sent3: The mahzor was so heavy that the rabbi joked about needing a weightlifting routine to carry it around.
meanings.sent4: The words in the mahzor lifted the spirits of the worshippers like a gentle breeze on a hot day.
meanings.sent5: As the cantor opened the mahzor, the prayers inside came alive, filling the synagogue with sacred energy.

meanings.definition: A collection of liturgical texts for specific Jewish holidays.
meanings.sent1: The mahzor for Passover includes the Haggadah and other important texts.
meanings.sent2: Families gather together to read from the mahzor during Hanukkah.
meanings.sent3: The mahzor for Purim was so old that it seemed to have its own stories to tell.
meanings.sent4: The melodies sung from the mahzor on Shavuot echoed through the ancient walls of the synagogue.
meanings.sent5: As the rabbi flipped through the mahzor, the history and traditions of the Jewish people unfolded before him.
